 It is essential to discuss with community leaders to set up a warning system and 
to identify safe areas in the village that can be used as a shelter. In areas where flooding and landslides frequently or regularly occur, people should prepare themselves before the rains start. In case of floods, usually a flood warning is 
given by the Government agencies. People must listen to this and take corrective 
action. They will then have time to collect their belongings and leave safely.
What to do during an earthquake
Some earthquakes are actually foreshocks and a larger earthquake might occur 
sooner or later. It is important to, therefore, be alert and plan joint action with 
other community members.
✱  If indoors, it is best to stay inside until the shaking stops and it is safe to go 
outside.
